contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Yamashiro'''|山城町|Yamashiro-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Miyoshi District, Tokushima|Miyoshi District]], [[Tokushima Prefecture|Tokushima]], [[Japan]]. On March 1, 2006 Yamashiro was merged with the towns of [[Ikawa, Tokushima|Ikawa]], [[Ikeda, Tokushima|Ikeda]] and [[Mino, Tokushima|Mino]], and the villages of [[Higashiiyayama, Tokushima|Higashiiyayama]] and [[Nishiiyayama, Tokushima|Nishiiyayama]], all from [[Miyoshi District, Tokushima|Miyoshi District]], to form the new city of [[Miyoshi, Tokushima|Miyoshi]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 5,220 and a [[population density|density]] of 39.67 persons per km². The total area was 131.59 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.tokushima-miyoshi.lg.jp/ Miyoshi official website] (in Japanese) [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Tokushima Prefecture]] {{Tokushima-geo-stub}}
